job description:
job description

pacific life is embarking on a multi year initiative to invest in dynamic people and technology to ensure a bright future for our customers and community  to support this process, we are looking for a senior data management analyst to join our team in beautiful newport beach, ca 

as senior data management analyst, you will play a key role in pacific life’s digital transformation by managing the design, implementation and improvement of the office of the cto’s enterprise metadata management processes, tools, and measurements  you’ll work closely with the data governance program manager and other data management analysts to contribute to the enterprise data strategy, driving improvements in metadata management adoption, efficiency, effectiveness and user experience 

what you’ll do
 lead the roadmap, approach and socialization of business processes, governance and supporting tools to drive our enterprise metadata management strategy forward  define the metadata management standards, disseminate this information to business and technical communities, ensure that data profiling and data quality monitoring rules are documented in the metadata repository  analyze data and partner with domain owners, data stewards and other business and it stakeholders to ensure governance functions are adhered to and the business has a full understanding of their data  collaborate across business and technical associates to identify and resolve data errors issues, escalating material issues that could impact business decision making  utilize data quality tools and techniques to help ensure that data accuracy is appropriate for the intended business use  ensure that business rules are maintained and data anomalies are resolved appropriately  play a leading role within project teams in the development and deployment of metadata management process improvement deliverables using the lean methodology  partner with other data management analysts and the data steward community to drive adoption of metadata management in each business area, ensuring alignment with enterprise standards  act as the focal point for enterprise and corporate analytics business partners, who are driving enterprise data strategy and requirements  support effective communication and training for metadata management process, tools and measurements  work closely with the core data governance team to ensure the definition and implementation for metadata standards meet the needs of the data steering committee 
tech   tools youll use

collibra data governance and catalog toolset, informatica data quality, aws cloud data warehousing, sql

factors for success
 5  years’ data governance experience that covers standards and policies, metadata management, data error resolution, data management and data quality practices, including data profiling and data quality monitoring  5  years defining and establishing metadata management processes within an enterprise that covers domains such as customer, finance, hr and compliance  3  years using collibra’s data governance and catalog toolset  2  years defining metadata standards  proven ability and demonstration of leadership skills, with emphasis on driving change across a diverse set of stakeholders  demonstrable experience with metrics gathering, tracking and reporting  experience working on complex business technology initiatives across multiple businesses  strong written and verbal communication skills, including drafting policies and procedures, and a demonstrated consultative approach in communication  demonstrated project management skills  intermediate sql query writing experience  data management experience in the financial services industry preferred  knowledge of data warehouse, data lakes and other associated technologies preferred  certified business intelligence professional  cbip  or certified data management professional  cdmp  a plus

req number
4768br
position location s 
newport beach, ca
full time   part time
full time

about pacific life

for more than 150 years, pacific life has offered innovative products and services including life insurance, annuities, and mutual funds, along with a variety of investment products, all of which provide the power to help you succeed  we firmly believe each employee plays a part in our continued growth and success, and we pride ourselves in providing a work environment that is challenging, inclusive, collaborative, and results oriented  with a powerful past and a strong future, pacific life offers an environment where you’re empowered to achieve your personal best  in return, we look to your passion and insight to help us grow  for additional company information, including current financial strength ratings, visit www pacificlife com 

benefits

join the pacific life team and watch your career grow  we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package that includes   competitive salary and bonus program  medical, dental, and vision as part our commitment in investing in the health and wellbeing of our employees  two retirement savings plans  401k savings plan with company match and company retirement contribution  company paid   generous vacation time and holiday pay  and much more 
eeo statement
pacific life insurance company is an equal opportunity  affirmative action employer, m f d v  if you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability  to request an accommodation, contact a human resources representative at pacific life insurance company

revolve is the next generation fashion retailer for millennial and generation z consumers  as a trusted, premium lifestyle brand, and a go to online source for discovery and inspiration, we deliver an engaging customer experience from a vast yet curated offering totaling over 45,000 apparel, footwear, accessories and beauty styles  our dynamic platform connects a deeply engaged community of millions of consumers, thousands of global fashion influencers, and more than 500 emerging, established and owned brands  through 16 years of continued investment in technology, data analytics, and innovative marketing and merchandising strategies, we have built a powerful platform and brand that we believe is connecting with the next generation of consumers and is redefining fashion retail for the 21st century  for more information please visitwww revolve comopens in new window   at revolve the most successful team members have a thirst and the creativity to make this the top e commerce brand in the world  with a team of 1,000  based out of cerritos, california we are a dynamic bunch that are motivated by getting the company to the next level  it’s our goal to hire high energy, diverse, bright, creative, and flexible individuals who thrive in a fast paced work environment  in return, we promise to keep revolve a company where inspired people will always thrive    some of the sweetest perks we offer aren’t in a typical benefit package like hefty discount on items we carry – as in 50  or more off retail prices, free weekly lunches, and pretty rad company parties    to take a behind the scenes look at the revolve “corporate” lifestyle check out our instagram  revolvecareers or  lifeatrevolve      main purpose of the position    the data intelligence analyst plays a critical role in actively building, upgrading, and maintaining the data centric nucleus of the buying and merchandising arm of revolve headquarters  this position partners with a multitude of end users ranging the spectrum all the way from buyers up to executives in order to keep us on the cutting edge of fashion retail by developing world class proprietary tools and internal processes    the data intelligence analyst’s primary objective is to support the buying and planning arm of the company in order to ensure that shrewd inventory purchasing and manufacturing decisions are consistently being made day in and day out so as to keep fueling our aggressive top line growth trajectory while continuing to push the limits of our bottom line profitability  we are a data driven, metrics oriented culture and lean heavily on our data intelligence team to be the first line of defense in ensuring that we continue driving the business forward and maximizing opportunities, all while minimizing risk by leveraging deep data analytics    the ideal candidate for the data intelligence analyst position should measure high on the scale for intellectual curiosity, ingenuity, and results  our analysts pride themselves on being out of the box thinkers who can collaborate well with a diverse range of input, feedback, and experience to consistently raise the bar and deliver results well above and beyond expectations  we are looking for candidates who are eager to make an impact and willing to go that extra mile  it is in our team’s dna to work hard and play harder      position responsibilities and daily tasks    build, extract, and data mine a variety of large data sets to identify trends, gaps, and opportunities in order to produce predictive insights and action items to move the business forward  design and execute experiments to produce proof of concept in order to help prioritize resource investments, recommend next steps, etc   examine business practices and develop predictive tools and reporting to support inventory purchasing, design, and manufacturing decision making   design and implement normalized data models   develop, test, and implement new business metrics   continually improve existing processes with automation, new technology, key insights, best practices   collaborate with analysts, data engineers, project managers, and subject matter experts to deliver impactful solutions and processes for new organizational initiatives   multi task a steady flow of incoming and concurrent projects and priorities ranging from high  visibility executive needs to adhoc requests from internal customers   engage with business leaders, end users, and team members to develop deep understanding of the business and its needs    what does a candidate need to demonstrate to perform this job successfully   advanced math skills, with deep knowledge and understanding of numerical and statistical methods   advanced understanding of relational database concepts   expertise in sql while being comfortable in an additional data programming language  such as python    advanced skills with stored procedures, functions, expressions, views   advanced proficiency with microsoft excel, vba and userform development   data mining skill, and expertise in visualizing and manipulating big datasets   aptitude for understanding business environment and translating business requirements to technical solutions   strong problem solving skills to propose multiple solutions, properly weigh tradeoffs and roi, identify the best path forward, and exercise good judgment to drive ahead   comfort interacting and collaborating with people across all levels of the organization while fielding questions as a true subject matter expert   ability to articulate thoughts and findings both orally and in writing   agile development mindset, understanding and appreciating the benefit of constant iteration and improvement   ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and to keep abreast of current and future technology and trends   ability to manage time effectively, set priorities, and meet deadlines   strong attention to detail   minimum candidate qualifications  years of experience, education level, technical skills, software, etc     a minimum of 2 to 5 years of quantitative analytical experience with a proven track record of achieving successful results from data mining large databases   advanced experience with designing and building spreadsheet models   sql and pl sql   excel   bachelors or masters degree required

hulu is the leading premium streaming service offering live and on demand tv and movies, with and without commercials, both in and outside the home  operating at the intersection of entertainment and technology, hulu has a unique opportunity to be the number one choice for tv  we captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love, and we’re looking for people who are passionate about redefining tv through innovation, unconventional thinking, and embracing fun  join us and see what hulugan life is all about 

summary

hulu’s data insights team is seeking a senior data analyst who will be an outstanding addition to our team  the team partners with other teams across the business to turn data into information, information into insights and insights into key business decisions that steer the strategic direction of the company  the right person for this role thrives in a fast pace environment, loves problem solving and is a good communicator  if you are someone who gains personal happiness from transforming data into knowledge for business insights, then this is a phenomenal role for you 

you will design innovative analytic approaches to test hypotheses, extract actionable insights by identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data, and develop recommendations to drive business performance  you will be instrumental in leading the use of analytics as a critical value driver across our organization 

what youll do
build analysis, data visualizations, and multi functional reporting that provides critical support to the operations and decision making of the organizationfacilitate the analytical needs of the business, collaborate in the design of diagnostic solutions, and deliver outstanding data products and insightsact as a liaison between business units   data engineering to drive key operational metrics for enabling business success and value addition within the data   analytics domainuse internal and external analytics tools, sql, and scripting languages to access and analyze multivariate datatranslate business functional requirements into technical specifications and, conversely, technical approaches into easily digestible termsdevelop and foster positive relationships and transparent dialogue with the business community and data colleaguesprovide analytics expertise to key business partners regarding data   analytics questionssupport business units, data teams and product program management with process improvements for optimized delivery of diverse data requeststake personal accountability for delivery of projects and committed timelinessupport business partners in adopting reporting solutions and business intelligence tools for self service

what to bring
a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, mis, statistics, economics, mathematics, etc 4  years of experience as an analyst in a data and analytics domainexcellent sql skills for complex querying, analysis, performance optimization, and persisting dataexcellent data visualization skills with tools like tableau, qlikview, microstrategy, etc experience working in a “big data” environment  hadoop, hive, presto, bigquery, snowflake, redshift, etc  experience demonstrating analytical concepts to craft an actionable story for technical and non technical audiencesfamiliarity with data science programming languages like r, sas, and pythonfamiliarity working with web analytics tools  particularly  google analytics, google search council, etc  understanding of data warehousing concepts, design, modeling and data engineeringexperience taking vague requirements and transforming them into crisp insightsintense curiosity, high intellectual and analytical horsepower, passionate pursuit of analytics driven insightsdemonstrable ability to build strong working relationships with business partners and technical colleagueswe desire the ability to identify and appropriately call out issues to leadershipwe would prefer strong motivation and ability to work independentlyoutstanding written and oral communication skillseffective presentation skills across a diverse audience

company overview

brady corporation is an international manufacturer and marketer of complete solutions that identify and protect people, products and places  bradys products help customers increase safety, security, productivity and performance and include high performance labels, signs, safety devices, printing systems and software  founded in 1914, the company has a diverse customer base in electronics, telecommunications, manufacturing, electrical, construction, medical, aerospace and a variety of other industries  brady is headquartered in milwaukee, wisconsin and as of july 31, 2019, employed approximately 6,100 people in its worldwide businesses  bradys fiscal 2019 sales were approximately  1 16 billion  brady stock trades on the new york stock exchange under the symbol brc  more information is available on the internet at www bradycorp com 

position summary

the strategic data analyst will work with the senior management team that includes the president, vps, directors, and managers of the company to provide analysis to explain sales trends and variances, identify sales growth opportunities and risks, assist in development implementation of strategic plans, and develop annual budgeting plans  the analyst must have demonstrated the ability to work independently, lead projects, think strategically, effectively work with the senior management team, and proactively review, interpret and integrate disparate data sources into actionable plans 

reporting and analytics

essential duties and responsibilities 
 perform analysis to identify opportunities and risks, and support business cases decisions for finance, operations, sales, and marketing teams summarize information from reports and analysis, and present findings to stakeholdersbuild models to explain and support business cases decisions build and maintain kpi dashboards to disseminate information used by internal customers to measure track results, identify and target sales opportunities, plan work activities, and make business decisions integrate reports, audits, and processes in various business systems 

data maintenance and process improvements
 assist with defining   maintaining business rules and governance for data prepare data in alteryx for reporting and analytics use in alteryx and tableau review, cleanse and maintain data in and out of multiple databases review, identify, recommend, implement, test and document data reporting process improvements work with it and key stakeholders to define, write up request, test and document system enhancements 

other
 prepare files for the annual budgeting processes assist with developing junior team members support customer data management and strategic pricing team projects identify   implement cross functional process improvement opportunities that support revenue growth, cost savings, and risk avoidance lead participate in special projects as assigned 

required knowledge, skills   abilities

to perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily  the requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and or ability required  reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions 
 3 5 or more years of work experience  preferably in the healthcare industry  working on data reporting analysis with increasing responsibilities bachelor degree is required  preferably in a business, computer or math related field mba a plus english fluency   ability to read and interpret documents, instructions, and procedure manuals   ability to write routine reports and correspondence   ability to speak effectively  ability to apply concepts of algebra, statistics, and probability  ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form   ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions  

desired knowledge, skills   abilities
 demonstrated ability to effectively work with and communicate with senior management team that includes the president, vps, directors and managers of the company demonstrated ability to lead complex analysis that involves integrating data from disparate sources both internally and externally demonstrated ability to think strategically and interpret strategic plans proficient in data reporting analysis software with preference for alteryx and tableau excellent computer skills in word, powerpoint and excel advanced level ability to organize complex data into comprehensible reports ability to interpret complex data into actionable information excellent research skills excellent communication skills, including interpersonal, written, and oral presentationstrong quantitative and analytical skills strong initiative and self motivatedstrong work ethics must be detailed oriented ability to work independently and in a team environment ability to meet deadlines ability to multi task ability to solve problems and think outside the box strong attendance record

the job

warner bros  entertainment inc  seeks an analyst, global insights and analytics for the global insights and analytics department 

qualitative research is the foundation of understanding global consumers   fans and is mission critical to business strategy today  through uncovering and representing transformational insights this role is as a strategic partner to business units across warner bros , warner media and at t 

the analyst, global insights and analytics requires use of primary custom research as well as secondary data tools resources to help inform business decisions around strategy, content and product development and refinement, communications marketing campaigns, and sales   distribution across warner bros  business units  in this role, the analyst represents the voice of the global consumer with insights that are relevant and actionable to our business partners  the analyst will be responsible for helping design, manage, and run consumer fan research, which includes global generational research, cross culture fandom studies, affinity and engagement work across wb brands and franchises, and product and content testing from start to finish  the analyst will work in collaboration with the vp, global insights and analytics   fanlab, utilizing various qualitative methodologies spanning in depth interviews, online communities, ethnographies, cultural immersions, focus groups, ideations workshops design thinking, concept tests, ux usability tests, ad marketing tests, biometrics, eye tracking, and more to inform global strategies  this person plays a critical role in translating global consumer findings into actionable insights in addition to creating narrative driven presentations  it requires someone who is globally minded and culturally fluent in order to help drive decision making  the focus of the analyst will be on helping to build a strong consumer research function, driving consumer centric strategy for the key business partners, and fulfilling primary research custom needs for the key global stakeholders 

the daily

 this role will be responsible for helping with all phases of the research design, recruitment, project timelines, discussion guide ux ideation workshop development, fieldwork, analysis, report writing and dissemination presentation of findings globally   critical to this role is the coordination and quality control to ensure the best consumer respondents possible for each of our studies  must be able to  with support and guidance , effectively support and help manage fieldwork operations, handle logistics  including screener development, facility location interactions, recruitment monitoring, and on site assistance during research projects    work on key primary research studies, such as global fan insights on key wb ip, global generational studies, global fandom studies, and territory cultural   entertainment assessments   act as liaison between the global insights   analytics team and external research and localization vendors   build and maintain relationships with vendor partners, including managing quality control, reviewing approving recruitment lists, and providing clear instructions  


 the essentials 

 ba bs, preferably in related field  including business, statistics, marketing, media, communications, film tv  required   minimum 1 2 years research experience required  previous studio, agency, network, or content platform experience preferred   globally minded and culturally fluent, with an understanding of foreign perspectives   an affinity for and understanding of the global fan which facilitates ability to identify untapped opportunities and deliver business impact   knowledge of current u s    global media landscapes and interest in the future of our industry a must   ability to work on a broad range of business problems at the same time   a strong relationship builder, working with people from different backgrounds   cultures and enjoy having a breadth of relationships across the business   strong primary research skills required, both quantitative and qualitative, with an emphasis on qualitative research methodologies   coordinate with various project teams to develop necessary materials for focus groups, workshops, ideation sessions, and communicate with business partners throughout   maintain clear, organized timelines of project setup, progress, and deadlines   evaluate, identify options, and make recommendations for addressing issues as they arise   utilize strong facilitation and communication skills to liaise with multiple global partners and internal project teams to ensure alignment on project objectives   expertise in microsoft powerpoint and excel   experience with video software   editing skills preferred   familiarity with secondary tools for us   global ratings systems  nielsen, itvr  a plus   tableau experience a plus   a highly motivated self starter with the ability to think strategically, work under extreme deadline pressure, and be flexible in prioritizing workloads   exceptional organizational skills and thorough attention to detail   a team player with a proven track record of building collaborative relationships across organizations   an innovator looking for new solutions, willing to explore new venues to further business goals   strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills   multi lingual   foreign language preferred

at roku, data analysts leverage big data to generate insights that fuel roku’s most significant business decisions  data analysts use a combination of technical skill, business intuition, and analytical thinking to partner with business leaders and provide actionable recommendations  data analysts are roku are thought partners to executive business leaders, so communication and presentation are enormously important  data analysts do not take direction from business owners and execute on ad hoc questions, they proactively identify the areas of the data and business that require attention and formulate analyses, insights, and recommendations based on an excellent command of the needs  the data analyst role at roku is a perfect fit for anyone who wants to continue to evolve business domain expertise alongside technical and analytical development 

the role

roku is looking for a data analyst to play an instrumental role in helping roku to continue it’s success by providing insightful segmentation, analysis of platform and behavioral trends, and a b testing  a data analyst need not only have strong technical abilities to retrieve, manipulate, analyze, and visualize data but also excellent communication capabilities  one of the key requirements of the role is to be able to collaborate with stakeholders and satisfies immediate business needs

responsibilities
 use roku’s big data to perform a thorough analysis design and evaluate a b experiments  develop data visualizations that illustrate complex platform phenomena using tableau, looker etc  partner with leadership, engineers, product managers and data engineers to understand data needs use creativity to find proxies where verbatim data or measurement is unavailable identify new applications for the myriad logged events in roku’s immense data catalog 

technical experience qualifications
 2  years of relevant experience as a data analyst in technology, e commerce, finance, or ad tech excellent command of sql and experience working with big data experience coding in r or python experience with data visualization platform like tableau, looker etc statistics knowledge  a b testing, statistical inference, interpretation of data, etc  strong communication skills ownership mindset, you own end to end lifecycle of a product starting from ideation, rollout to post launch performance tracking academic background in math, physics, computer science, economics

energy for what’s ahead

are you looking to make a difference in your career  we’re working on smarter grids, cleaner energy and tools to help people manage energy more efficiently 

about transmission and distribution

southern california edison’s  sces  transmission and distribution organizational unit  t   d  is responsible for planning, engineering, constructing, operating, and maintaining transmission and distribution facilities throughout the 50,000 square mile territory  t d is the steward of roughly  19 billion in assets that safely and reliably deliver electricity to 14 million residents via sce’s 5 million customer accounts 

position overview

this position will be in the technical planning design contractor hub within sce’s transmission and distribution  t d  organizational unit  the technical planning analyst will support process improvement projects and oversee the design and maintenance of organization reporting tools, scorecards, and metrics 

typical responsibilities
 import and export planning progress reports  ppr  using customized access database  poletracker   award poles in poletracker for design to internal external design resources  process deteriorated pole work orders to the pole project management group  ppm   update poletracker with dates when work order packages are received from contractors  validate data in poletracker from planning progress report  ppr  to ensure it matches the work order packages received from planning resources  verify work order information using design manager, sap, sharepoint, and other database resources  review and respond to joint pole organization  jpo , return to originator  rtos , preliminary status reports  pres , and planner memos  utilize primary and secondary data sources for tracking, reporting, and performance measurement  develop and generate internal external reports for performance and scorecard data  develop ad hoc reporting as needed  work with internal clients and design contractors to address scope, process, and billing issues  develop process manuals, job aids, and flow charts  utilize sas visual analytics for data extraction and reporting perform other duties and responsibilities as assignedqualifications

minimum qualifications
 two or more years of experience as a program or project support analyst performing complex data analyses  experience utilizing advance functions of microsoft excel such as sum ifs, v lookups, index match, pivot tables, macros, and manage and analyze large datasets  experience using sas visual analytics for data extraction and reporting 

desired qualifications
 bachelors degree in business, information technology, business analytics, or other related field  experience with pole tracker, project tracker, design manager  dm , sap, sas va  or other visual analytics software   must be highly proficient in microsoft excel, word, access, powerpoint, and outlook  experience providing high level analytics, including statistical analysis and use of visual analytics, to understand areas of improvement  experience working with construction design work orders  experience giving presentations and using reporting metrics to provide recommendations to leadership  experience with sap’s ariba functionality and invoice billing processes  must demonstrate ability to stay current with relevant technology and innovation

 candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work directly as employees for any employer in the united states without visa sponsorship  
southern california edison, an edison international  nyse eix  company, serves a population of approximately 15 million via 5 million customer accounts in a 50,000 square mile service area within central, coastal and southern california  join the utility leader that is safely delivering reliable, affordable electricity to our customers for over 125 years

job description

data strategy analyst – la
 who are we 
 as a company built on the foundation of privacy by design, for more than 20 years neustar’s unique capabilities have made us the leader in the field of responsible identity resolution  neustar enables trusted connections between companies and people at the moments that matter most, with world class and industry leading solutions in marketing, risk, communications, security and registry services   what is a data strategy analyst 
 the data strategy analyst will possess in depth technical and analytical expertise, credibility, and field experience, to establish yourself as a subject matter expert  sme  in the marketing industry, ad tech, dmp, crm, and marketing analytics such as marketing mix modeling  mmm , multi touch attribution  mta , segmentation, propensity modeling, a b testing, and targeting   what you will be doing 
 serve as the sme and technical liaison between clients and neustar services, providing support through multi phased delivery projects  gather business and technical requirements in order to create and present a comprehensive solution and implementation plan for client delivery  design and complete implementation of technical data integrations, identifying cadence, delivery methods, quality control, etc  lead conversations with client data owners and media agency partners to understand strategy through data and identify data attributes critical to our modeling process  acquire and assess client data from a multitude of sources for usefulness in analytics  common tasks involve data mapping, identification and application of business rules to data sets, data validation, and data analysis using statistics and machine learning techniques  guide clients and internal development teams with technical requirements  present data insights to clients and internal teams   establish relationships and partner with other functions to deliver client value  identify ongoing risks and pain points throughout project experiences and contribute to improving data acquisition practices, automated data pipelines, data validation methods, and overall cross functional deployment processes  deliver market feedback from customers to product and engineering to drive continuous improvement    what we would love to see 
 2 to 5 years of experience in marketing research, agency, consulting, ad tech, software, and or data integration solutions  ability to navigate across functional organizations and adaptability to new different situations  resilient work ethic with the capability to adapt to the situation, flexibility and nimbleness in terms of work planning, and the ability to think quickly on your feet  excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate neustar’s service portfolio of solutions  excellent diagnostic skills to identify issues within data sets and identify solutions  travel to client sites  average of 15   but may be higher or lower based on the client engagement  digital marketing experience with ad servers, dmps, dsps, audience creation targeting, multi touch attribution, or other relevant experience is a plus  experience and understanding of the following technical areas are preferable 
 data analysis skills using tools such as excel, sql, tableau, python, sas, and r  relational database concepts, ability to read write sql queries  etl, data management, and data quality best practices  amazon s3, hadoop hive, or similar technologies  web apis and web developer tools   bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, economics, statistics, computer science, or experience in related analytical technical field is required   why work for us 
 at neustar, we are committed to the growth and development of our employees whose individual skills, curiosity and passion for their work, contribute to the overall success of our business  our core values  accountability, collaboration, transparency, resilience, and respect  are the driving force of our culture across our locations around the globe  we offer our employees a comprehensive benefits package including perks such as tuition reimbursement, awesome company discounts, back up day care, community service events, pet and baby swag and much more  we are all learning and creating together  and having some major fun along the way    
join us  we can’t wait to meet you

 diversity

as a data analyst you will be a vital part of the data team and work with finance and operational teams to create end to end tracking of spend, revenue, and cost centers  you will own the design, development, and validation of ongoing metrics, reports, and related roadmaps to drive key business decisions  we are looking for someone who is constantly thinking of ways to improve our products and the business 

responsibilities
 write etls to make financial data consumable to our finance, operations, data, and executive teams conduct hands on modeling analytics retrieving, compiling, and analyzing large volumes of data from disparate databases into distilled, actionable information and insights collaborate with product, operations   marketing to deliver on key projects  this will include data provisioning, exploratory data analysis, data visualization and in some instances, statistical modeling champion the analytics process – from business understanding, data understanding, data preparation, data modeling, evaluation, and deployment  lead by example and by training business stakeholders with varying technical and non technical backgrounds design and analyze a b multivariate tests to drive kpi improvement

preferred qualifications

were an ambitious, smart, and open minded group  our employees are passionate about our mission, and eager to complete their work at the highest level  the office itself is up tempo and supportive, because we care about each other  people first, people

bird is the world

overview

the data analyst will develop data analytics and business intelligence to improve the quality of control testing and increase the risk, control, and regulatory coverage across the enterprise to support internal audit activities in accordance with the standards for the professional practice of internal auditing  responsibilities will include gathering, manipulating, and synthesizing data and other relevant information to draw conclusions and make recommendations 

responsibilities
 build and execute data analytics to support audit objectives, using tool such as excel, sql, power bi, python and others   query and analyze small and large data sets to discover and analyze patterns, identify anomalies, profile and reveal relationships from banking data   assist with data analytics projects and gather and analyze complex and large amounts of data for supporting ongoing audit projects, investigations, management requests, and special projects  extract and collect large data sets from various sources and formats   interpret and analyze results from data extractions to identifying patterns and trends   evaluate internal controls and identify deficiencies through the testing of data source, systems, and processes   define new data collection and analysis processes   test and validate that key assumptions, data sources, and procedures utilized in measuring and monitoring risk and internal controls can be relied upon on an ongoing basis  and, in the case of transaction testing, to assess that controls are working as intended   test adherence with bank’s policies and controls, as well as regulatory requirements   maintain an understanding of business operations, operational risks and regulatory requirements   anticipate changes in the internal and external environment and adapt the testing program accordingly   validate the integrity of data, including data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis   provides recommendations to streamline tasks and create a more efficient working environment   report results back to management and relevant team members   product knowledge in  loans  deposits  banking operations

tamara mellon, co founder of jimmy choo, is no stranger to success or rule breaking  true to form, tamara is now doing things differently— really differently 

headquartered in los angeles, her three year old namesake label is the first ever direct to consumer luxury women’s accessories brand  what this means in short  old school italian craftsmanship without the retail markups 

for us, new luxury also means reinventing the shopping experience  anyone who shops with us  or is a fan of the brand for that matter  is a vip— think best in class customer service  we call them liaisons  and complimentary shoe care with every purchase 

we’re dead serious about disrupting the status quo, and not just in the fashion industry  an outspoken advocate of women’s issues, tamara mellon is creating a community of like minded, next gen consumers 

if you’re a rule breaker like us, and this sounds like the opportunity  not the job  you’ve been waiting for, we’d love to hear from you 

summary

you will be leveraging your analytics skills to provide business insights and strategic guidance to help drive growth in our dtc omnichannel  e commerce and stores  business  our ideal candidate is passionate about data, a strategic thinker, has a high attention to detail, and can also think creatively  you are proficient with analytic tools, have a strong working knowledge of sql, and can utilize your skills to solve unique problems and answer important questions  you should also have a passion for retail e commerce data, with experience in all aspects of running an e commerce business including marketing, supply chain, customer engagement, etc  

we are looking for someone who is ever curious and self motivated  as a member of the analytics and data science team, you’ll partner closely with your data teammates as well as executive leadership and key business stakeholders to inform data driven strategies and actions that drive business growth 

responsibilities
 collaborate with leadership to identify business improvement opportunities  collaborate with other departments to help drive key business decisions via data and analytics, kpi tracking and custom reporting dashboards   present data and findings to cross functional team members  have a strong command of the company numbers   be the first line of defense in reading shifts in performance trends and proactively communicate opportunities  get hands on with large data sets   build models to analyze trends, develop strategic recommendations with goal of always improving performance  work cross functionally with our marketing, merchandising, digital product   engineering, and supply chain teams   analyze data using visualizations and statistics to evaluate performance, identify actionable insights, make recommendations, and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating your findings  ensure data quality by qaing and uating your work, and that of your colleagues  provide testing recommendations and identify areas for further research  partner with website technology teams to troubleshoot data and tagging issues, optimize platform integrations, and identify areas for data sanitation and cleanup  you’re adept at closing tickets in the data backlog, but you’re also pursuing and uncovering actionable insights you find in the data yourself   diagnosing problems by diving into the data and identifying trends and presenting opportunities 

requirements
 retail e commerce experience strongly preferred  proven track record of turning raw data into meaningful analysis, presenting to business stakeholders, and driving value for the business  must be a self starter that can work independently, understand expectations, and demonstrate insatiable curiosity about what the data is telling the organization   experience with marketing measurement techniques including media mix modeling  mmm  and multi touch attribution models  mta  expertise with web analytics tracking, specifically google analytics  experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as tableau, microstrategy, or looker  strong knowledge of sql  basic familiarity with statistical methods and concepts, including hypothesis testing, statistical tests, and regression analysis  a commitment to and appreciation of accurate and consistent data  proven communication, coordination, and collaboration skills  proven ability to collaborate with a variety of technical and non technical stakeholders  willingness to take initiative  familiarity with a statistical programming language  r or python  is a plus 5  years of experience across analytics, digital marketing, and technology 

benefits
 competitive salary  medical, dental and vision  carrot fertility  equity 12 weeks maternity paternity paid leave  unlimited vacation policy  fast paced, energetic and entrepreneurial culture with long term career development opportunities  employee discount

description

job title data engineer analyst

when you join us at thermo fisher scientific, you’ll be part of a smart, driven team that shares your passion for exploration and discovery  with revenues of  22 billion and the largest investment in r d in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world  as our data engineer analyst, you will support the biosciences division, which represents over  2b in sales annually  the journey will be intense, but impactful and rewarding 

how will you make an impact 
we are looking for a data engineer analyst that sees beyond just reports and is a strong advocate of efficiency and optimization  the ideal candidate is inquisitive and eager to find  and communicate  nuances and details many others could miss  you enjoy exploring more varied and complex data streams to piece together for use towards generating actionable business insights  you relish going beyond marketing data such as web analytics, operations, hr, finance, lead funnels, contracts, offline, loyalty, crm, and other sources used for business intelligence  you are versed in industry leading analytics strategies and are always looking for ways to improve performance digitally and offline  you are comfortable pivoting and flexing as needed, as we continually evolve and refine our methodologies 

curiosity and critical thinking are key, as well as, balancing details and the bigger picture  self assessment and continual growth are mandatory in analytics, as the field constantly changes  i e  shifts in search engine algorithms, data flow approaches, tools, etc    data and figuring out new uses and approaches must fascinate you, but you are also proactive with information sharing to improve processes and tribal knowledge  in our world, perfection is the enemy of good, so you must be comfortable with 80  complete data  you are willing to be proactive and to dig in, to surface and adjust for nuances 

do you find it thrilling stripping down old hypotheses and creating new ones, followed by observation, testing, and further modifications  do you have a knack for multitasking and efficiently getting tasks done as you pivot from one to another  when you have enough directional data are you capable of sifting out insights to guide the business  if so, you may be a great fit 

how will you grow 
thermo fisher has numerable educational resources that go beyond analytics to become familiar in other areas of interest  data science, digital marketing, etc    some courses provide university credits for uci  there are also many skills training  microsoft office tools, process improvement, etc   there are also career planning resources that cover and go beyond management and leadership training  ex  conflict resolution, problem solving, communication, body language, diversity   inclusion, etc   a strong employee appreciation program and dedicated budget are also in place  mentorship and guidance will be provided by teammates and the bid analytics leader at a minimum as there are many other employee involvement programs, as well  reporting directly into the bid analytics leader, you will receive regular coaching, two way feedback, air cover, and genuine appreciation on jobs well done  she will support your growth opportunities within the team and beyond as she notably cares for the well being of her team  this team has a strong unified, positive, supportive, collaborative, zero egos culture that fosters trust and progress 

what will you do  

recurring and ad hoc integrated reporting to help business units assess health and performanceassess and improve efficiencies and automation to permit time for proactive support and insightsmaintenance of existing and to be built reports and processesmethodologies to determine roi of various marketing effortsexploration of complex and novel data sources within the organization for use in future reporting and analysisrelationship management between analytics and partners  marketers, executives, cross divisional groups enable stakeholders and teammates with documentation of techniques, best practices, conducting training sessions, etc continual self education to improve techniques and evolve our analytics processes and strategydomestic and international travel 10  or less of the time

how will you get here 
bachelor’s degree or above required

3 years of data experience required  web, digital media, bi, crm, data lakes etc expertise in powerbi data transformation, integration, processes, optimization, and visualization requiredstrong experience with cognos  or similar advanced ms excelprogramming languages  sql, r, python, etc preferred
statisticstagging implementation qadata sciencemarketing experienceexperience working in a large corporation within a matrix org structure

relocation benefits
this position does not offer relocation benefits, but remote applicants will be considered

 extract and combine data from disparate data sources in order to draw meaningful conclusions and make recommendations on how to enhance our platform work with a cross functional team to understand business requirements and promote data driven decision making during all phases of a project’s lifecycle present the results of your analyses to technical and non technical stakeholders develop data models to understand and predict user behavior  churn prediction, propensity to spend, and more oversee the data collection process and ensure key pieces of information are being tracked properly build dashboards to allow stakeholders to easily access data and monitor kpis provide intuitive data visualizations that send a clear and concise message keep up to date on data trends and help the team to remain competitive in the game space

employees join the trade desk to discover opportunity, contribute to our customers’ success, and be part of building the future of marketing  you’ll work with creative, compassionate, and collaborative colleagues that share a passion for making the internet better for all – a combination that simply cant be beat 

when you join the trade desk, you’re joining a family  we have open space work environments, adjustable sitting standing desks, and a celebrated open door policy  at all levels  that can inspire out of the box solutions and camaraderie among your coworkers  the competitive compensation packages, full benefits, stock options, and additional discounted stock purchase opportunities, catered lunches, and offsite team building activities may cause slight to severe jealousy among your peers 

who we are looking for

the global bi team works closely with a broad range of teams including client services   product   engineering   finance   marketing to provide business intelligence reporting, address complex questions and help identify key metrics to drive data driven decision making  we’re looking for someone who is enthusiastic about new technology, has not only the existing technical skills to be successful but also the acumen to learn even more  you’ll never run out of things to learn here  you’re comfortable being a mediator between business and technology teams, helping both reach solutions on high priority technical issues  there is plenty of room for advancement in this role within the department or otherwise within our company that is a meritocracy

what you will be doing
 you will manage and resolve ad hoc business intelligence requests, developing new tools to automate repetitive tasks you will use predictive modeling techniques to drive business growth and generate accurate revenue forecasts you will support the business with time critical data analysis and improve business operations by using cutting edge operational research and modelling methods you will maintain the integrity of company data and put checks in place to ensure accuracy you will apply a broad range of analytical techniques to identify business critical trends and insights by exploiting big data you will create dashboards and reports to allow teams to easily explore data pertinent to their ongoing operations you will serve as a subject matter expert for data analysis methods and tools, as well as data visualisation best practices

company description

about zenith 

at zenith we are dedicated to creating a sustainable advantage for our clients, providing them with a quantifiable return from their communications investment that outstrips their competitors  our focus on roi ensures that clients budgets are invested, not simply spent  we believe the most important consideration for any campaign is a demonstrably effective outcome  we are committed to developing close partnerships with all our clients and delivering a service that always exceeds expectations 

job description

who is zenith analytics 

at zenith, we’re changing the way some of the biggest brands in the country – including verizon, chase, kohl’s, american cancer society, and more – talk to consumers  we put a data driven understanding of our clients’ customers first, so we know whom to reach and when to talk to them  and by keeping our finger on the pulse of consumer attitudes and reactions, we know how to keep that conversation on track  that’s at the heart of live roi, and it all starts with analytics 

what does zenith analytics do 

working closely with both the business planning and activation teams, analytics designs the data strategy to tie our clients’ marketing to real world business goals  we then mine that data to optimize campaigns and tell the stories that bring our clients closer to their marketing, helping them understand if they’re talking to the people they want and if they’re doing it the right way 

what does a successful analyst look like 

we don’t all look the same, and we don’t expect you to, either  but a successful analyst should share our passion for emerging tech and media, bring a data driven approach to decision making, determine a point of view and share it positively, gear up for a challenge, and always crave to learn more and improve  familiarity with media analytics helps, especially digital media, but isn’t necessarily a requirement  prior professional experience is highly preferred 

what does an analyst do day to day 

analysts form the foundation of the analytics team  they pull and arrange data from a multitude of sources to feed business improving insights, then build thoughtful presentations and reports that bring the story home to our clients  they work closely with a senior analyst and or manager to learn the most efficient and effective ways of wrangling with data as they learn to become full fledged storytellers 

qualifications
ba or bs from 4 year accredited university agency experience highly preferred professional or academic experience working with large data sets or conducting quantitative analysisstrong communication skills  ability to speak and write professionally  ability and comfort with presenting work by phone or within small groupsproficiency in microsoft office software such as word, excel, and powerpointworld class customer service skills  ability to service clients, partners, and internal stakeholders by understanding their needs, translating those needs into creative solutions, and delivering on those solutions with diligence and a sense of urgencyknowledge of digital media metrics  impressions, clicks, ctr, cpm, etc  knowledge of analytics tools and relational databases  google analytics, sql, ms access, tableau advanced excel skills  ability to work with macros, advanced formulas, pivot tables python programming language  required basic knowledge of cloud computing systems

additional information

all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines

what were about

we want to become customers personal designer   personal tailor 

at frilly, we empower our shoppers by providing on demand clothes that fit their clothing style and body  our customers get curated life like 3d collections according to their tastes, fit, and shopping habits  we also manufacture our clothes in house to ensure that only the best quality is provided to our shoppers and that they receive it as quickly as possible  we consider ourselves as one of the pioneers in ar shopping and we’re here to revolutionize the fashion industry 

our use of 3d designs helps us generate many more products in a much more cost effective way  using an on demand business model provides us with a lower return rate, as well as reducing our carbon footprint  we design in 3d, only make the products that are ordered by customers to minimize the waste, and we use sustainable fabrics as much as possible  all this is to say, we take sustainability very seriously 

at our core, we are a product company  we are in the process of building a team that includes product managers, product designers  both fashion and digital  and product delivery managers 

now, we are looking for a director of data   analytics to join our los angeles team  this new position will be responsible for the design, development, implementation and ongoing management of enterprise analytics and data management  this role is responsible for leading business intelligence, data warehousing and big data delivery across multiple functional areas  they will use analytic practices to address business challenges and provide recommendations  this leader will be a strong communicator, have a talent for simplifying analytic outputs and demonstrate sound business judgement 

responsibilities
 manage data and analytics platforms including data warehouse assist in the creation of compelling, persuasive presentation materials to communicate key learnings and recommendations to executives clearly and concisely track and analyze large amounts of data to discover meaningful trends and present to key stakeholders of the organization on a weekly basis build modeling and analytics around frilly customers including lifetime value analysis, a purchase propensity model to feed into early customer segmentation, and acquisition cost allowable for the various marketing channels assist in the development of new reporting standards and methods for all aspects of the organization identify customer trends and recommend data driven responses to help guide strategy and decision making for market expansion, customer   revenue growth support marketing team with reporting, analytical insights and make strategic recommendations related to the media performance and marketing support for each market and campaign assist in the management of dashboards and analytics that communicate status and evaluate effectiveness of all ads, promotions, offers and campaigns  contribute to data aggregation strategy for reporting, dashboards, and self service analytics

requirements
 bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, cs or relevant degree 5  years of relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging analytics and large amounts of data to drive significant business impact  experience preferably within tech company strong skills in sql and proven experience working with at least one of the major databases platforms  sqlserver, oracle, db2, mysql, sybase, or postgres  advanced sql query writing and experience implementing and working with analytics data warehouses strong analytical skills  ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations proficiency in data modeling best practices, and designing   building data pipelines  a passion for and track record of leveraging data for business impact, preferably in a consumer facing digital environment talent for translating data into easy to understand, actionable insights 

benefits
 100  covered health stock option flexible hours dog friendly office

the countys public safety departments, through its law and justice group, actively utilize data driven analysis to evaluate the effectiveness of public safety services countywide  the law and justice data analyst, assigned to the county administrative office, will collect and analyze criminal justice related data in an effort to identify and understand problems and their causes, and will assist in city of hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient centered philosophy

position summary

the senior market research analyst is responsible for selecting the appropriate research methodology and supporting techniques to meet defined reporting objectives  the senior market research analyst will possess healthcare financial and operational acumen to develop research methodology  the role requires a detail oriented candidate with critical thinking and database management skills to complete ad hoc projects  the senior market research analyst scrutinizes the collected data, prepares reports and makes recommendations to the management team  the senior market research analyst works closely with manager ensuring the successful execution of the projects aligned with city of hope’s strategic plan 

key responsibilities include
 collecting data on healthcare competitors, industry, and market place and consolidating information into actionable items, reports and presentations  compiling and analyzing statistical data and perform valid and reliable market research swot analysis  interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations  utilize online market research and catalogue findings to databases  provide extensive competitive analysis on various healthcare organizations’ market offerings, identify market trends, business models and methods of operation  evaluate program methodology and key data to ensure accuracy, keep abreast of market trends, latest research, and implement best practices  create reporting catalogue, document methodologies, design and maintain databases   follows established city of hope and department policies, procedures, objectives, performance improvement, attendance, safety, environmental, and infection control guidelines, including adherence to the workplace code of conduct and compliance plan  practices a high level of integrity and honesty in maintaining confidentiality 

performs other related duties as assigned or requested

 critical thinker and analytical mindset, with excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation and interpersonal skills  ability to interpret and synthesize large amounts of data into reports and presentations  ability to multi task and prioritize projects under limited supervision  working knowledge of data warehousing, modeling and data mining and managing complex projects  designing qualitative and quantitative research for healthcare competitors, markets and service lines   excellent knowledge excel, powerpoint and databases  e g  access  programming experience preferred  vba, sql, etc    fair knowledge of statistical packages  spss, sas or similar ,  adequate knowledge of data collection methods  truven health analytics, advisory board, seer data, etc

who is zenith analytics 

at zenith, we’re changing the way some of the biggest brands in the country – including verizon, chase, kohl’s, american cancer society, and more – talk to consumers  we put a data driven understanding of our clients’ customers first, so we know whom to reach and when to talk to them  and by keeping our finger on the pulse of consumer attitudes and reactions, we know how to keep that conversation on track  that’s at the heart of live roi, and it all starts with analytics 

what does zenith analytics do 

working closely with both the business planning and activation teams, analytics designs the data strategy to tie our clients’ marketing to real world business goals  we then mine that data to optimize campaigns and tell the stories that bring our clients closer to their marketing, helping them understand if they’re talking to the people they want and if they’re doing it the right way 

what does a successful analyst look like 

we don’t all look the same, and we don’t expect you to, either  but a successful analyst should share our passion for emerging tech and media, bring a data driven approach to decision making, determine a point of view and share it positively, gear up for a challenge, and always crave to learn more and improve  familiarity with media analytics helps, especially digital media, but isn’t necessarily a requirement  prior professional experience is highly preferred 

what does an analyst do day to day 

analysts form the foundation of the analytics team  they pull and arrange data from a multitude of sources to feed business improving insights, then build thoughtful presentations and reports that bring the story home to our clients  they work closely with a senior analyst and or manager to learn the most efficient and effective ways of wrangling with data as they learn to become full fledged storytellers 



desired skills and experience
ba or bs from 4 year accredited university agency experience highly preferred professional or academic experience working with large data sets or conducting quantitative analysisstrong communication skills  ability to speak and write professionally  ability and comfort with presenting work by phone or within small groupsproficiency in microsoft office software such as word, excel, and powerpointworld class customer service skills  ability to service clients, partners, and internal stakeholders by understanding their needs, translating those needs into creative solutions, and delivering on those solutions with diligence and a sense of urgencyknowledge of digital media metrics  impressions, clicks, ctr, cpm, etc  knowledge of analytics tools and relational databases  google analytics, sql, ms access, tableau advanced excel skills  ability to work with macros, advanced formulas, pivot tables python programming language  required basic knowledge of cloud computing systems

this is a contract position offering a lucrative salary and benefits package that is valued
up to  105,490 annually 
our retirement plan has reciprocity with calpers and 37 act plans 
future salary increases of 3  effective july 18, 2020
bi annual step increases of 2 5  up to step 14
the countys public safety departments, through its law and justice group, actively utilize data driven analysis to evaluate the effectiveness of public safety services and community centered programs countywide  the public policy data analyst, assigned to the county administrative office, will collect and analyze criminal justice related data in an effort to identify and understand problems and their causes critical to the well being of the local community  this position fills a critical role that works to help develop and improve policies and programs in line with the countywide vision goals of improving community health and public safety 

essential duties will include
 designing, conducting and supporting complex research studies and program evaluations  determining appropriate statistical methods  testing and operationalizing hypothesis regarding system issues data mining from disparate systems and integrating to a central database format to generate ongoing reports or conduct inquiries and studies assisting in the development of baselines and indicators for ongoing management and continuous improvement in public safety services throughout the county collaborating with county departments, officials, community leaders and other agencies to obtain data  working closely with research consultants to hone down data requests and analysis and convey results analyzing and interpreting data, identifying findings and presenting them in visual and narrative formats that are understandable to practitioners handling and accessing confidential information and protecting the confidentiality of data shared across the justice system
the law and justice data analyst is a contract position serving at the pleasure of the appointing authority  the incumbent will not attain regular status as a county employee 

desired qualifications

the qualified candidate will possess a bachelors degree in statistics, mathematics, criminal justice, social science, business public administration, or other quantitative field that included coursework in statistical methodology, research design or data statistical analysis, and two years of progressively responsible administrative, professional, investigative, or technical experience with statistical analysis, research design, data collection, combining and analyzing quantitative and qualitative data sets, and refining analysis to both policy audiences and practitioners 
the ideal candidate will possess a masters degree in a qualifying field and have experience collecting and analyzing data across different data systems and working collaboratively with justice system practitioners and policy leaders across various justice system agencies  additionally, the ideal candidate will be skilled in sql, ms excel and access, stata spss sas r, as well as data visualization tools to make data compelling and actionable  graduate research students are encouraged to apply

the opportunity 
the sr  manager is responsible for leading a team of analysts that use business data and statistical methods to provide insight into business performance and suggest area for and methods of optimizing the customer journey touchpoints  this individual will leverage data and statistical analyses to drive understanding and make recommendations to optimize the customer journey  this position strives to support the business in making fact based decisions for touchpoints such as strategic planning and marketing plan development and supports many internal clients including brand, retail, catalogue, web and book wholesale  this position is also responsible for driving new sources of data, maintaining the integrity of data in our marketing data warehouse, and executing all customer level campaigns  this position will report directly into the vp of marketing 

 what your impact will be 
 decision making inputs primarily include compilations of customer knowledge  trends, purchase behaviors, channel preferences, product relationships , and projections of future revenue based on customer file dynamics   provides strategic inputs to marketing plan development to provide framework for improving our marketing mix  builds corporate test   learning plan to measure the effectiveness of marketing tactics to support fact based decisions   oversees the development of statistical models to select ‘best’ customers for direct to consumer marketing efforts   assimilates large amounts of detailed information and communicate the findings issues in a succinct, coherent manner to audiences of both technical and non technical individuals  implements analytical approaches and methodologies and assists in the interpretation of results  may collect and analyze external market data to provide benchmarks for comparison purposes  

 what were looking for 
 bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent preferred master’s degree preferred 10  experience in analytical leadership role 10  years of experience in data analytics function in positions of progressive increasing responsibility and scope and demonstrated strong performance  5  years of leadership experience with demonstrated success in employee development, coaching, hiring and performance management  extensive data analysis   database mgmt experience, direct mktg knowledge, previous experience in strategic and or marketing plan development advanced erp systems, excel, powerpoint skills  produces highly accurate   dependable results  manages multiple projects simultaneously  possess excellent written   verbal communication skills  meets strict deadlines skillful at supporting cross functional cooperation and building strong working relationships across business unit operating teams  independent and objective thinking to properly evaluate, communicate, educate, influence and gain cooperation in reaching consensus, decisions, and action  results orientation and initiative  conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure  ability to positively lead and adapt to change and operate in a dynamic organization 

 what it’s like to work here 
mattel is passionate about our employee experience, which is built on community, opportunity and purpose  our employees are at their best when they’re recognized, rewarded, and empowered to drive their own mattel journey – that’s why we offer flexible work schedules, unlimited paid time off for exempt employees, a generous holiday schedule, and a competitive compensation and benefits package  depending on location, we also provide on site resources like childcare and a fitness center to help seamlessly integrate work and life  there are endless opportunities to grow here, with a strong focus on career development, open access to senior leadership, and on site and online training  employees often say the best part of working at mattel is the people, and we build our community through employee resource groups, clubs, leagues and activities that allow you to bring the “whole you” to work  we’re a family friendly, inclusive, purpose driven company that provides ample time and unique opportunities to give back to the communities in which we work and play  our employees embody our wonder values and are ready to put them into action every day 

 who we are 
mattel is a leading global childrens entertainment company that specializes in design and production of quality toys and consumer products  we create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play  we engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic franchises, including barbie®, hot wheels®, american girl®, fisher price®, thomas   friends® and mega®, as well as other popular brands that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies  our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events  we operate in 40 locations and sell products in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the worlds leading retail and technology companies  since its founding in 1945, mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in exploring the wonder of childhood and empowering kids to reach their full potential
